subject: Dead Sensor
caption: Dead sensor at I2;;;;Waveform showing the time at which this element ceased to record ground motions
description:
The sensor at the I2 element died late on 2020-11-30 and remains dead through the end of the reporting period. Added a plot pinpointing the problem onset on 2020-11-30.
UPDATE: This sensor was removed on 2020-11-30. We have updated our metadata to reflect this, and we will close this ticket accordingly.

subject: Dead broadband sensor
caption: Last time period when sensor was recording ground motions;;;;Data returned but as digitizer noise
description: All 3 channels of the broadband sensor at FSAH1 are not recording ground motions. We have approached Randy about this sensor but it is not resolved. This ticket remains open. I looked at bit more closely at this. Apparently, ground motions were recorded up until 2019-11-28, at which point there was an outage. The data returned on 2020-01-16, but only as digitizer noise. I have an email out to Randy to see if we can update out metadata with an end date of 2019-11-28 for this sensor.

subject: Dead broadband sensor
description: Keeping this ticket open for a dead broadband sensor. Added the 'dead' threshold, based on the 'dead_channel_gsn' metric. Looked more closely at when this problem began. Looks like data went out around 2019-11-28T03:35:00 and came back as digitizer noise on 2020-01-16T01:30:00. I have an email out to Randy to see if this sensor should be closed in our metadata.

subject: Dead sensor on the I2 element
caption: Waveform showing time that the I2 element ceased recording ground motions;;;;Spectra showing dead sensor at I2
description:
The I2 element appears to have a dead sensor. Problem appears to have started late on 2020-11-30. Added an image pinpointing time of problem onset.
UPDATE: this sensor was removed on 2020-11-30. WE have updated our metadata to reflect this, and subsequently, the ticket will be closed.

subject: Elevated noise on broadband
caption: Spectra computed with old WATC metadata;;;;Spectra computed with corrected WATC metadata;;;;Spectra computed with IRIS metadata
description: All 3 broadband channels exceeded the 'hiAmp' threshold. This issues has been corrected in our metadata inventory and will soon be installed. However, the ticket will remain open until the station passes thresholds. Metadata has been updated for the 2020-12-14 period. This has improved noise spectra, but noise remains elevated enough to still exceed thresholds. Ticket will remain open pending a discussion with the A-Team.

subject: Gaps
caption: Waveform showing typical gap pattern for CDF channels.;;;;Daily number of gaps for the ADKI.01 element. Pattern in similar for all elements.;;;;Number of gaps affects percent_availability for all elements.
description: All elements of the ADKI array exhibit large numbers of gaps in the CDF channels for the entire reporting period. Daily number of gaps appear to spike on 2020-11-20 and 2020-11-21. These gaps continue, but metric generation for these channels will cease until they can by down-sampled.

subject: Gaps
description: There were large numbers of gaps on the infrasound at I53[H,C]5 between 2020-11-3 and 2020-11-05. These gaps were likely associated with ongoing maintenance avtivity.

subject: Gaps
description: There were large numbers of gaps in the infrasound at I53[H,C]6 between 2020-11-02 and 2020-11-04. These gaps were likely associated with ongoing maintenance activities.

subject: Gaps
caption: Comparison of IRIS-downloaded vs WATC-downloaded waveforms for ELK.BHZ showing gaps in WATC data but not in IRIS;;;;Daily number of gaps on BHZ. Similar numbers for all components
description: All broadband channels at US.ELK exhibit high numbers of gaps for the entire reporting period. The same data from the IRIS FDSN do not exhibit gaps. There appears to be a communication error at some point. Gaps continuing through the current reporting period.

subject: Gaps at DLL
caption: Large numbers of gaps on the 12th and 17th;;;;Large number of gaps on the 12th. All other elements of DLL exhibited a similar gap pattern
description: All elements of DLL experienced large numbers of gaps on 2021-01-12. Additionally, DLLH1 experienced large numbers of gaps on 2021-01-17.

subject: High amplitudes
caption: High amp I4 ;;;;High amp I5;;;;High amp I6
description:
High amplitudes were flagged for FSAH4.I[4-6]. Likely a wind event?
These elements continue to be noisy into the current reporting period. Keeping the ticket open and changing the status to "In Progress".

subject: Low Data Availability
caption: Plot showing low availability during the 1st half of the reporting period
description: Low availability for the San Juan broadband continued into this reporting period. Improved during the second half of the week.

subject: Malfunctioning weather station at FSAH2.M1
caption: Waveform showing digitizer noise from the met channels;;;;M1 waveforms with sensitivities removed. Not flagged.
description:
Continued dead channels for the met sensor at this station. 

Update: Not dead but continues to have issues. This was seen from manual inspection (quarg did not flag).

Update: This is being looked at by several folks.

subject: Metada problem on shortperiod
caption: Figure showing undefined values on the short-period seismometer inventory
description: The orientation is undefined of the short-period seismometer. Metadata has been updated for this sensor.

subject: Metadata issue
caption: Broadband elevated noise continues;;;;High amplitude on BH1 on 2020-12-24;;;;Possible metadata issue (high amp not flagged)
description:
Metadata issue known from the start of this reporting period (but is seen in previous week). 

Continuing to see metadata issue for entire reporting period (2020-12-21 to 2020-12-27) for BH1 but only on partial period (2020-12-21 to 2020-12-25) on BH2. High amplitudes were flagged on 2020-12-24 for all channels (higher than seen on previous day).

Bad response continues to be flagged during 2021-01-04 reporting period but only for 2021-01-05 for BH2 and 2021-01-08 for BH2.

subject: Metadata problem
description: Orientation is undefined for broadband horizontal channels. Metadata has been updated for this station.

subject: Metadata problems
caption: PDF showing mid-period noise dipping below the nlnm;;;;;;;;
description:
The noise spectra for the 3-component short-period sensor at this site show significant mid-period energy below the noise model, indicating that there may be a problem with the response. Also, azimuth and dip are undefined for the vertical channel.  
The orientation data has been updated in GMP. We should be able to close this ticket next week.

subject: Noise
caption: ;;;;Spectra at 05 showing significant noise centered around 0.5 seconds;;;;Waveform showing probable wind at 05
description: Elements 2 and 5 broke the hiAmp threshold on 2021-01-16. The noise is significant between 0.2 and 8 Hz. The waveform for this time period appears consistent with a wind event.

subject: Outage
caption: Plot showing low availability at H1 on 2021-01-13. All H elements experienced similar low availability on the this date;;;;Plot showing that the outage at the H elements did not affect reference sensors
description: All elements of I52 experienced data availability near 0 on 2021-01-13. This outage did not affect reference sensors. The data appears to have backfilled.

subject: Outage at I52H?
caption: Plot showing low availability on the 2021-01-13. All elements show an outage for this date. ;;;;The reference sensors at I53 were unaffected by the outage on the 13th.
description: All elements at I53 experienced an outage on 2021-01-13. This outage did not affect the reference sensors. The data appears to have back-filled.

subject: Outages at QSPA
caption: BHZ ;;;;QSPA BH1;;;;QSPA BH2;;;;Large numbers of gaps at QSPA. All components were similarly affected;;;;Gaps at QSPA significantly affected availability for the reporting period. All components similarly affected
description:
Gaps and outages for entire reporting period at QSPA BH?. Outages not symmetrical for all elements.
UPDATE: Large numbers of gaps continue for all 3 components for this reporting period.

subject: Spikes during likely wind event
caption: FSAH2.I5 spikes;;;;FSAH2.I5 waveform
description:
FSAH2.I5 exceeded nSpikes threshold on 2021-01-09 during wind event seen at other elements. Only element I5 exceeded nSpikes threshold; other elements that exceeded high amp thresholds due to wind had much fewer spikes.
UPDATE: numSpikes did not flag for this period, although the hiAmp threshold was broken. This ticket will remain open, although we are tweaking infrasound noise thresholds next week.

subject: Transient Noise
caption: High amp I1;;;;High amp I5
description:
Transient noise on FSAH2.I[4-6] on 2020-12-23. Possibly wind? 
High-frequency noise continues into the current reporting period. Now visible on all elements except for I2 (dead sensor). Adding elements 1 and 3 to ticket and changing status to "in progress".

High amplitudes continue for on 2021-01-09. Likely wind.

subject: Transient Noise
caption: Spectra showing transient noise;;;;High amp I3 on 2020-12-23;;;;High amp on I4 on 2020-12-23;;;;Noise continuing into the latest reporting period;;;;Updated image showing elevated noise at FSAH3.I3
description:
These elements continue to experience transient noise. Particularly on the 2020-11-30. No transient noise this period.

Elements continue to be flagged for high amplitudes on 2020-12-23.

Same issue continues into this reporting period.

Same Elements continue to be flagged on 2021-01-09 - 2021-01-10

Same elements flagged for the current reporting period. I tweaked the quarg thresholds slightly as infrasound thresholds are set less conservatively than broadband, and we are flagging relatively small amounts of high-frequency noise.

subject: Transient Noise
caption: Waveforms showing transient noise recoded on several FSA sites on 2020-11-27;;;;Updated noise plot showing high-frequency noise at FSAH4_I4. Other elements at H4 display similar spectra on this day
description:
Transient noise was visible on all infrasound elements of this station on the 23, 24, 27, and 28. The noise was apparent at several FSA sites at these times and is most likely associated with wind. These channels continued to experience noise, particularly on 2020-11-30. These stations did not flag for noise this reporting period.

Continue to exceed high amp thresholds on 2021-01-06 (FSAH4.I[4-6]) and 2021-01-09 to 10 (FSAH4.I[1,3-6]). Likley wind.

Continue to see high-frequency noise for this reporting period, particularly on 2021-01-14. I am relaxing the 'hiAmp' thresholds for infrasound as the noise in not significant.

subject: Transient Noise
caption: ;;;;Spectra showing elevated noise at high frequencies;;;;Waveform showing transient noise at the I4 element;;;;High amp spectra on 2020-12-23;;;;High-frequecy noise continuing into the current reporting period;;;;Updated noise plot for FSAH7.I3 showing high-frequency noise
description:
Elements 3 and 4 exceeded the hiamp threshold on 2020-11-27. This noise was apparent at other FSA sites and is most likely associated with a wind event. Continued transient noise on 2020-12-15 and 2020-12-20.

High amplitudes continue on elements 3 and 4 on 2020-12-23 and on element 4 on 2020-12-24.

Noise continued into the current reporting period for these 2 elements.

High amplitude thresholds broken on 2021-01-06 and 2021-01-09 for FSAH7.I4. Likley wind event.

These elements continue to be noisy, particularly on 2021-01-14 and 2021-01-15. I am relaxing the 'hiamp' threshold for infrasound and it is currently set conservatively.

subject: Undefined Azimuth and Dip
caption: Dip and azimuth are undefined for the broadband horizontal channels
description: Both the azimuth and dip are undefined for the horizontal channels of the FSAH5 broadband. This metada has been updated.
